title: Standing waves - fundamental freq with 4x tension

content.question: The fundamental frequency of a standing wave on a string with tension <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math> that is fixed at both ends is <math alttext="f sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math>. When the tension on the same string is increased to <math alttext="4 T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>T</mi></math>, the fundamental frequency of the standing wave is <math alttext="f sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="f sub A, end sub, to, f sub B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
